summary: The FIZZ-NO Act of 2025 aims to amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to prohibit the use of Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits to purchase soda. The bill defines soda as a carbonated beverage containing more than 1 gram of added sugar, artificial sweetener, or flavoring per serving. The act would take effect 180 days after enactment.
